revised_title: A Study of Jeypoorite: A Sulph-antimonial Arsenide of Cobalt
tldr: The author analyzes Jeypoorite, a mineral found in the copper mines of Khetree in India, and discovers that it is a sulph-antimonial arsenide of cobalt. The mineral is used by local jewellers for blue enamels and imparting a rose color to gold.
